Title: A Review on Code Generation with LLMs: Application and Evaluation
Abstract: code generation is a longstanding subject in the field of computer science and software engineering which aims at realizing an agent capable of writing code automatically aligning with human desire. with the booming development of large language models  large language model  in recent years code generation techniques powered by large language model with strong coding ability have caught many researchers' interest. in this study we conduct a review of recent studies about code generation with large language model from the application of large language model based code generation to the evaluation of large language model generated code. we find with the powerful code understanding and writing ability large language model provide these novel techniques can be applied to manage various software engineering tasks and indeed boost the productivity of developers to a great extent. but we also find as an equally important subject the evaluation receives less attention from researchers than the application. we conclude some limitations in existing studies about the evaluation of code generated by large language model like inadequate quality characteristics considered. and we think more effort is needed to narrow the gap between research on the evaluation and the application.
